website_summaries.verdict: If traditional string lights aren’t an option for your outdoor space, consider these Edison-style lights equipped with a solar panel. Create a sophisticated dining area in your backyard.
pros: Durable bulbs hang from a 27-foot string
Solar panel may be clipped or staked
Charge only requires six hours of sunlight
Includes a sensor so lights turn on when sun sets

customer_reviews.title: If you purchased check them out before you throw the box away !
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed! The esthetics of the lights and strand are pleasing unfortunately it is the only nice thing I can say , that does me no good ! I can’t even give the item a rating due to the fact that some of the led bulbs do not light up all the way . Plus they don’t give you any replacements! The lights do not what so ever create enough light for even ambiance! Each bulb equates to what a fire fly would look like ! Extremely over priced !!!!! And I had to give it one star or it wouldn’t let me submit my review!!!! Very Displeased !!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Li

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor lights!
customer_reviews.text: The lights are sturdy and easy to install! I wrapped them around a tree and they look great. It’s nice that they turn on automagically when it’s getting dark. UPDATE: I had to adjust my rating from 5 to 1 star as my lights seems to have burned out after only a few weeks of installation... not sure what the shelf life should be but this seems way to short for this amount of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bettina Kunkl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product installed them in two places to cross a ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product installed them in two places to cross a patio via some small steel cable. No need for power as they charge via a solar panel they come with.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: They don't work. They are being returned.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a vendor event under a canopy. They worked at home when we tested them for a minute or two. And never worked again. We were forced to a last-minute dash to Walmart to pick up a different set of lights. These are going back to the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: These lights are great!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are great. They put out a nice amount of light for our patio. The bulbs are a nice size and the wire is plenty big to support the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name (required)

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working - excellent customer support
customer_reviews.text: (Update) Customer support was excellent. They walked me through some troubleshooting and we determined the solar panel was not properly working. They shipped me a new solar panel right away and everything is working again. Yay! I put 2 sets of these up about 7 months ago (bought a year ago) and one set stopped working already. I’ve emailed the company as their manual says there is a 5 year (3 years plus 2 years free extended) warranty. I will update my review when I hear back from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome so far.
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. it is exactly what i wanted. bright enough to set the mood, but not too bright. cool looking lights. will update is any issues arise but since installation, they come on every night and bring a nice ambiance to my porch space update. through winter snow and summer storms, still going like clock work!
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality. Nice lighting. Heavy duty wiring.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. Nice lighting. Heavy duty wiring. I installed a set of these on a pergola I recently built adjacent to my firepit. They provide a nice amount of light. One problem was that one light bulb (plastic) was cracked. It didn't affect the LED LIGHT but I had to glue it. Hopefully it will still keep the rain out.
customer_reviews.author: Amashopper

customer_reviews.title: 50% working
customer_reviews.text: I had one great month use out of them. Not sure what is going on but one of the light set works perfectly fine. The other one stopped working. They are connected near each other and receive the same amount of sun to charge the lights. Maybe I have one bad unit. I'll contact customer service and see what can be done. I would have rated them 5 stars as it was doing what we intended it for. A Mama Mia type setting is now gone and now we are starting to entertain out back.
customer_reviews.author: Esther N

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but...
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good. They're not bad. They're just not great. Pros: They're solar. They're are easy to set up. They look great. Cons: They're just not that bright. We obviously don't want them lightening up the night's sky, but we do wish that they were a little brighter. We ultimately kept these, for now anyway. But we'll have to look around better to see if any others fit our needs better.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Dim, but stay on all night long! I recommend 2 strands.
customer_reviews.text: I took the video at 6AM... lights are still on and have not lost any power (brightness). They are hanging in a 12’x16’ porch and are pretty dim for the area (when my eyes do adjust to the darkness, I can see everything on my porch, but no way you could read or write). However, I do love that they stay on all night and I never have to worry about them. Just ordered another set for a little more light.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent string lights! My 4th set.
customer_reviews.text: Lights were easy to install with s-hooks on a wire (purchased separately). I live in the redwood mountains, where nights can be very dark and critters numerous. The lights are bright and nicely light up the deck area. When light is not needed (watching the recent meteor showers), the lights can be easily turned off with its on/off switch. I also like the vintage look of the lights. Very pleasing. I have had other solar string lights; good light ambiance but they were not bright enough to make the area visible. Brightech are the best solar string lights I have ever purchased. Highly recommended! Just ordered a 4th string of Brightech lights for my daughter's house. Again, excellent lights!
customer_reviews.author: bberg

customer_reviews.title: Nice but misleading description
customer_reviews.text: I do really like these lights. Brightness is perfect, they seem sturdy, and I like the look of them. However I think the description is misleading. I have exactly 27 ft railing so I thought these would be perfect. However the actual lights are only like 18 ft long. There’s a long wasted extra cord on each side of the lights (6 ft one side and 3 ft the other) that I didn’t know what to do with.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Solid, simple soft lighting
customer_reviews.text: Installation was quick and easy. I appreciated the adjustable angle of the solar panel. The light is very soft (some might say dim) but that was what we wanted. This lights a carport with a soft diffused light that gives just enough illumination to help people walking up to the door. I may buy a second string and put it along the other side of the carport, just to brighten it a little. Very pleased with my purchase. [Edit] In fact, I just bought a second set to light the other side of the carport.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Enhancements needed!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two sets of these. They do light well and with less charge time than stated...just for a shorter period of time. They need two design enhancements: 1) the lead cord from solar panel to string lights is too short. 6’. You beat sun spot may be farther away from where you want to hang them. They should offer optional longer cable. 2) the far end of the string just ends in a flat cable. Would be better if it had a loop. We had to tie a knot and use a zip tie through the knot to tether it to a hook in a tree.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Spruces Up the Backyard
customer_reviews.text: These lights are a great addition to our backyard. We strung them between upright posts spaced about 4ft apart. I like that there is an on/off switch if you don't want them to come on every night when it gets dark. The solar panel was easy to mount, and the clip option is even easier to set up. You'll probably want more lights and/or a porch light or something depending how bright you need it. These are more decorative than bright in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Allison S

customer_reviews.title: Quite Delighted with These Lights
customer_reviews.text: I love anything Solar and these lights are just perfect! My patio is almost all shade, so I mounted the Solar panel on a snow shovel handle and move it around to catch the sun during the day (hoping the tree trimmers will come and I can mount the panel permanently). The clip is so strong I can barely open it with one hand, so it's solid. The connectors are very robust, not flimsy as you might expect. I bought special clips and mounted the lights on my privacy fence so I can see them at night through the sliders. Very festive! I'm in NE so I think I will bring them in during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: LindaC

customer_reviews.title: Buy them! You will be happy!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are incredible! I have been using solar lights on my deck for a while and none are nearly as wonderful as these! They are bright and a nice warm glow but not too yellow looking like some solar lights. I just ordered a 2nd set because I love them so much! Lastly. I appreciate that they include 3 ways to hang them. 1) you can screw the solar panel into something. 2) you can use a clip to secure it. 3) you can use the stake to stick into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Katie N.

customer_reviews.title: 1 1/2 years later working perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these lights almost a year-and-a-half ago and they've been working perfectly every night ever since (left out 24/7). The solar panel faces South and the lights illuminate automatically every night without fail. I also like how long the string of lights is. Perfect for my deck. I purchase some other solar string lights from a different manufacturer a year before and they were glass and they broke and they leaked within 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Light up the night
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I clipped the solar panel to one of the legs of my canopy tent and strung the lights along the inside. After dark they lit up the canopy just fine. I’ll will buy another set just to cover the rest of the canopy as I strung the lights diagonally instead or around. And did I mention the best part - they are dolor so no need to have electricity - no need for a plug!!! Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, well-made, heavy-duty solar lights are worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: We have these strung around our backyard pool. They provide beautiful light at night. The solar panel is the largest I have seen. The lights and cords are heavy duty. If you have used other solar string lights, you will be shocked at how much better made these lights are. I feel like they will last a long time, unlike the cheaper lights I have bought in the past. I hesitated at the price for these lights, but now I think they are definitely worth the price. Just know that these provide a lot more light than my previous lights, so if you are looking for very, very low light you might be disappointed. Otherwise, these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M. B. Buffaloe

customer_reviews.title: Great Company and Great Solar Lights
customer_reviews.text: I bought these solar lights March 2019 and they recently stopped working.... I couldn't find a replacement battery anywhere so I contacted the company Brightech asking where I could find another battery... I was please to see a response from the company and found out the lights were still under warranty and they will be sending me another solar panel.... Because of their response I'll most certainly buy more of their products as they stand behind their product.....
customer_reviews.author: Gail M..

customer_reviews.title: Shine bright!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how bright these are. I bought them for a little ambiance lighting for our deck, which unfortunately does not have any power source. I had initially had the string of lights inside after unpackaging. I left them in our living room overnight. I came downstairs in the middle of the night and thought someone had left the light on in the room by how much light was coming off. Granted, it’s not enough to rely on if you need light for reading, etc. Easy to hang, so far holding up to weather (I.e heavy rain and winds).
customer_reviews.author: my review

customer_reviews.title: Cute, Easy to Install, and Nice Light
customer_reviews.text: They're not bright enough to actually read by, but they add enough light so that I don't worry about people tripping and falling on the deck in my backyard. They're easy to install; I hung them on plant holders (shepherds hooks) around the perimeter of my deck and screwed the solar panels to the studs at the ends of the deck. They do look nice and add enough light to keep things from being pitch black. I don't know if they're weather proof or not; I'll report back in the winter. Overall, I'm pretty happy with this purchase. I may add some more around the hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Diablita

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install; I hung mine from sturdy branches of the small trees in my yard. I live in the very rainy PNW and even during the winter, the lights lasted about 3-4 after dark. During the sunnier days, the bulbs go about 6-7 hours after dark. I LOVE these and am actually about to purchase more. I like the plastic bulbs, because no one likes shattered glass in their yard. They made it through a rainy winter and still look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylynne

customer_reviews.title: Way too dim. Barely visible light only lasts 2 hours per charge.
customer_reviews.text: I hung them over the walkway to my front door so I could see the sidewalk and unlock the door. Even with 2 strings, They don’t provide enough light to see the sidewalk. Each strand has a 3 foot tail of cord that doesn’t plug into anything or allow you to connect strings. I’m thinking it’s there so they can say the light string is longer than it really is. The bulbs are plastic, which is fine, but they are not protected in the box at all and both sets arrived pretty scratched up. It doesn’t really show once they’re hung up.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Paw Luke

customer_reviews.title: Easy install,  no cords needed!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these lights for a gazebo that did not have power run to it. In the past I used extension cords to run lights but it made it difficult to mow and keep the yard tidy. When I found these I had to try them! I would say one strand leaves a soft romantic glow so I'll probably buy a 2nd strand just bc I like my atmosphere bright. So easy to install and no cords needed!! Just make sure you have a sunny area to run the solar panel. My yard is very shaded that may be the cause of the soft glow.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn C.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t last long
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights and tells you to leave them a review and follow them on Instagram and tag them to receive a gift card and never did. Also I bought these 2 1/2 months ago and now they are blinking and turning off and on like there is some sort of shortage. I have to say as much as I spent on these light I am disappointed now. However when they work they are gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: 1st set we ordered never worked straight out of the box. There was a short in the cord. So we ordered a second set a few months later thinking we may have just got a bad set. This one worked very good for 5 days however they now are dim and will only come on for a couple hours. I have reposition the solar panel to try and ensure good access to the sun and left the switches off to build a good charge. Normally I only leave good feedback or nothing at wall but the company wanted a review. So there it is.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great lights - don’t forget to press the on button!
customer_reviews.text: I received these lights about a week ago and immediately went about setting them up. First of all, I must say they are exactly like the picture. Stylish. Cute. Love them. When I first put them up I waited until they received a full charge during the day to really judge them - the first night there was nothing! Then the second night, nothing. I felt like I must have done something wrong - yup! Don’t be a fool like me when you buy these and miss that there is an on off switch you must press for them to automatically come on at night.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Zupp

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I did all summer.
customer_reviews.text: Over the past 6 months I have purchased my 4 of these string lights and each one has lived up to standards! The lights are “ambient” which is what I was looking for in my deck. I don’t have to worry about turning them on or off which is a plus. The lights stay on all night up to 5-6am. They are eco friendly and the bulbs are plastic so you don’t run a risk of breaking them. I relied heavily on other people’s reviews of these lights before I decided to go for it. The pictures don’t do much justice. I promise you won’t regret it. I surely did not!
customer_reviews.author: I_will_stop_at_muffin

customer_reviews.title: These are very good looking, very durable lights
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a very specific look. I wanted solar and plastic (after previous glass ones shattered). These fit the bill. I have left them up outdoors for half a year, including through winter and lots of rain and snow. I also live by the beach, where the air is filled with salt and it's constantly windy. So far these have held up very well. My only complaint is that the lights are pretty dim. Their dim glow look very pretty, but don't expect them to really "light up" any significant area. Also the length is fairly short, most decks/patios will require 2+ sets.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Seemed good but only lasted a week.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t get the chance to unbox and try these until last weekend. They were up all of a week and it was a miserable process. The fastener on the plug to the solar panel doesn’t hold. I could not keep them hung for the life of me with that thing constantly uncoupling and the string falling. When I finally taped it so it would hold together, it worked for one night then the lights stopped working except the first one. They were nice for the moments they worked but they are not durable for outdoors as far as I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle

customer_reviews.title: You light up my life, for free!
customer_reviews.text: The lights are great! Comparing them to the strings of lights they replace; the bulbs are plastic, not glass, the lights are as bright or even brighter than the bulbs they replaced, the wiring is lightweight and black, the previous wiring was slightly heavier and brown, (my wife didn’t like the brown wiring on the black iron fence), the replacement doesn’t require a timer, and finally the lights don’t use electricity since they are solar! Technology is great, when the right company uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Electric Bear

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Ambience Lights
customer_reviews.text: I always read reviews before buying anything from Amazon, and I always think that I should also do the same, to help others make their decision. But I never did so in past couple of years. So this is my first attempt towards that. We had it for a while and last weekend my husband hung them in our balcony. Very beautiful not too much light and not too dull. Perfect for our balcony. I cant say anything about the durability yet. Will update on that in 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: These work very well. I like that there is a solid lead (6 feet?) between panel and lights so you can find a good spot for the panel. Panel seems high quality. Bulbs and wiring seem solid (wouldn't call them pro grade, but not flimsy either). We have the panel in a very sunny area and wrapped the lights around the deck railing. They went well over 10 hours in one test we did. The light is just right, not faint, not bright. It's a very nice touch to have some lighting come once the sun goes down.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy well built lights
customer_reviews.text: So far I’m very pleased with these lights. They are the 27’ models and I strung (4) of them over our garden from the garage to the fence which is about 17’. Keep in mind at one end the lights start 6’ from the solar panel and at the other end the light starts about 4’ from the end so even though the total length is 27’ there are no lights on 10’ of the entire run. The seller is upfront about this so I ordered the 27’ and they work perfectly for my area. So far they are holding up to the rain and the light output is fine and gives a nice warm glow.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty product
customer_reviews.text: These lights are well made, easy to mount and have a convenient solar panel disconnect. Because each lamp has a mounting hole on top, I was able to thread them onto aircraft cable. Past string lights would break easily from wind or even squirrels using them as make-shift highways. The cord is the heaviest I have seen for solar powered lights. I am hoping for many years of use from my two units.
customer_reviews.author: gjohnpage

customer_reviews.title: They were easy to hang
customer_reviews.text: We've had these up for a week or two. They were easy to hang, work well and reliably and are really cute. The solar panel has a stake option and a clip option, which is helpful and thoughtful. I think they're a bit pricey compared to what else is out there, but I'm hopeful that means that they're going to last for a long, long time.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to charge the solar panel at least once before the day you need to use it.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for a street festival I had to do. I hung one strand of these lights around half the perimeter of my 10x10 tent and it worked very well (my tent was white, with white walls, so the light reflected off the walls nicely). People were able to see my products without problems. Make sure you test the lights out before you need to use them. I'm very happy with this product and will use it again. Maybe next time I'll get a second strand.
customer_reviews.author: momwith2kids

customer_reviews.title: Solar power last way into the night.
customer_reviews.text: I have many sets of solar but I have to say these solar vintage Brightech look gets give a good amount of light ,heavy duty cable is great hold up to the wind . I’d wouldn’t buy anything else . One of the best things besides lasting for hours is the clip that is strong and super convenient to clip anywhere house to fence even to a sturdy limb of tree great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine soliz

customer_reviews.title: Lights are very bright! Work great!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lights! Soft bright lighting!! Bought these to put up around camp, not thinking that they would be that bright but they are brighter than I expected, especially for solar lights! I dont sleep well at camp so I have been awake many nights and the lights last the entire night, until the sky begins to lighten in the early morning. We bought a few more sets after the original one because they work so well. Ours are strung outside in the weather with absolutely no issues. Love my lights!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Heath

customer_reviews.title: Dim, inadequate amounts of light
customer_reviews.text: No stars because no light, not bright, dim, can't call it anything more than a bathroom night light level of bright.
customer_reviews.author: joseph.staudenraus

customer_reviews.title: fantastic customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 strands of lights. Suddenly, one wasn't working and when we took down the solar panel---it had water in it. Maybe we didn't have it angled enough---I just don't know. But the other kept working fine. We contacted customer service. They replaced it under the warranty for free/free shipping, etc. Really within 1 week of contacting them we had a replacement. It works great! Take home from this---make sure you set your panel at a severe angle to avoid any water collecting. Most importantly, company stands behind product and super easy to communicate with! Even though my product malfunctioned, I would buy from this company again! BTW, lights are beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: hghmom

customer_reviews.title: I've had watches that put out more light.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a string of lights that will last 12-18 hours, these are for you. If however, you want lights that put off more light than an aging firefly, keep shopping. I charged these in direct (repositioning to maximize) sunlight from 8am til dark, then turned them on... The "brightness" can be best described as "bright enough to confirm they're on, without actually creating light". The light doesn't really leave the bulb. They're on their way back.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: So far works well
customer_reviews.text: We just wanted a little light for our rabbit enclosure. They are in an inclosed porch. About 15'x17'. The lights are not bright, but that's perfect for our needs. We live in a rural neighborhood. Big yard, lots of trees, no street lights. So it gets really dark at night. These lights are solar so no electricity use. And just enough light so the rabbits aren't in total darkness... No idea if they are waterproof, they are in an enclosed porch. When the sun goes down, they come on and stay on until dawn. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Buy this! Already want a second one !
customer_reviews.text: Love these and very high quality! Many compliments on them from friends and family. Only wish is that they were warm-tone lights and not a bright-white tone but they are pretty and happy it’s not the ugly fluorescent white which is a huge plus. I put the solar part outside in the sun every other day and then bring it in at night and stick the stake in my giant monstera plant which is where it attaches. Here is a photo of it in the day time. I used the small wire 0.5 lb command hooks to hook each light bulb and that worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Harrington

customer_reviews.title: perfect for New York winters
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to light up the path on the side of my garage and could not be more pleased with my purchase. I attached these under the eaves of my garage - the solar path lights I've used in the past work great until that foot of snow comes! then we don't find them until the spring thaw! with 12 lights on one strand, these give just the amount of light needed to light up the field stone path that leads to the door on the side of my garage. very pleased!!!
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Best outdoor patio lights
customer_reviews.text: I love these patio lights, for many reasons - You can place them anywhere (don't worry about finding an outlet and running an extension cord) since they are solar (the only way to go and only things we've been buying for years). They are strong, bright and we love em ! Going to order more sets for the back yard. (we have the long set of these that are 110v - the ones you plugin, and these are almost as bright as those are) so they are very good quality !
customer_reviews.author: J&R

customer_reviews.title: put solar panel on direct sun
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad we found theses solar power fueled outdoor lights. I had been looking up different ones but we don't have outlets outside of our home. This was almost too good to be true but it actually works. I'm literally amazed and they turn on by themselves when it starts to get dark. Just make sure the solar panel is directly under the sun so it gets a full charge. They'll be on all night. They turn on and off by themselves. I am in love. Best part: no electricity bill.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and attractive lighting for the path to my garage
customer_reviews.text: I have a dark sidewalk following along a fence leading to my garage door, and nicely strung these along the fence (simple little screw-in brass hooks work great). For now, I'm using the clamp method to hold the solar panel and it works great, though it looks a little bulky (it would be nice if that option had the ability to swivel both ways instead of just one). I may switch to simply screwing the panel into the fence. The lights are a perfect brightness, lighting my way to the garage, and yet looking like a delightful design element, and they last all night when you've had a sunny day.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Guither

customer_reviews.title: BEST SOLAR LIGHTS I EVER BOUGHT!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE LIGHTS!! mom had them in her backyard and after seeing them at night I just had to have some for my pergola. Worth the few extra dollars compared to others! These are true Edison’s! (Not the cheap kind that hardly put off any light and only stay lit for a couple hours after sundown) these guys are lit full force until at least 5am, GREAT!! So glad I found this brand, had a couple other solar twinkle lights from amazon last year that I’m not impressed with. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! These guys were $10 more than the ones I had previously and SO much better.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for one week
customer_reviews.text: The first week or so I had this it was great - looked good, lit up nicely each night. Then it suddenly stopped working. If I fidget with the cord enough and twist it in just the right way, I can get the lights to work for a whikle, but it's a royal pain to do this and for the money, I expected this to work without any effort. The problem does not seem to be the solar panel, rather something in the wires. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Great for backyard relaxation!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these up for a couple of days but so far I love them! I purchased three strings to run around the exterior of my fire pit seating area. They provide just the right amount of light for my purpose. I would describe the light as warm and yellow/orange in tone. I was a little concerned when I tested the third string and it didn’t light up, but it worked fine after the solar panel had a full day to charge in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: A. Payton

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these...just pay attention to the cord vs. light ratio
customer_reviews.text: My 1950s home is short on exterior outlets so these solar string lights were very appealing to me. I can put them anywhere without having to worry about ugly, hazardous extension cords. I like the options to install the solar panel: a big clip, a stake, and some screws with anchors. I strung these lights up on my new privacy fence using 3 eye hooks and clipped the solar panel to the top of a dogear post. Please note that you do have a lot of excessive cord on either end. After loosely draping the string I would say that the actual footage of lights is 20-22 feet. I used zip ties to clean up the loose ends.
customer_reviews.author: Malissa A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and romantic in doors.
customer_reviews.text: Love the solar lights. Im not going to risk it getting it wet. My kids love the lights in doors. I place the solar panels out side so my room is half lit . Some what romantic . Best to place the solar panel where most sun light is beaming. It last 4 hours average facing East. On a good day almost 6 hours. I have it for more than three months and they are still working.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good after a week!
customer_reviews.text: I asked the company about the color of light and they said: "The color temperature for these lights are 3k soft white". I hung two strands and put the solar panels on the (barely pitched shed) roof attached to a brick. They lights turn on after sun set and turn off as the sun rises. I expect this performance to wane as the panels and bulbs age some, but time will tell. I needed one more strand to complete the look which is why I inquired about the warm v. soft bulbs they show on their website (Amazon was out of stock). Suddenly they were back in stock here so just ordered another strand!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: These are really nice lights
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait until I had these for a few months. I purchased 2 of these in July for our backyard for a birthday get together. They really look nice. The appeal of these lights are amazing. They just give that feel of cozy and calm. With that being said I only give it 4 stars because they really are not that bright. Maybe if I added another strand or 2 but I don't think so. So if brightness is something you want these are not those lights but if you want intamit, dim, and comfortable these are great!
customer_reviews.author: venessa  huntington

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lights
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement to another set of solar string lights that became damaged. Upon unboxing I noticed wire was thicker than previous pair I had and bulbs seem stronger. Gives off just the right amount of light. Put up in evening hours and they seem to have come fully charged. Well wortb price and come in different length. Not sure how waterproof they are yet, hopefully I can add to review later
customer_reviews.author: Tim M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking lights
customer_reviews.text: These seam to be nice set of lights not overly bright but really nice for ambiance style lighting. Casts enough light to see but not enough to read. Easy to string and space time will tell about waterproofing as they have only been up a few weeks lets see what the winter does to them. They do not stay lit all night long, this could be the placing of my solar panel as it does not get direct sun all day or it could be that this is the way they are, but do go well into the night. Hope this helps good luck enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Sleeper.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: All bulbs are lit and equally bright. Only awkward part is that the clamp mechanism is not aligned for left-sided, vertical clamping to side of a screened-in porch. Can't maneuver the solar panel to face out and be flush with screen to get direct sunlight. Has to be aligned backward at an angle, or it would go through the screen. Seems to either be acceptable to charge, or it is holding its original, full charge for a week. Looks nice and has comfortable glow. Not overpowering light, which is good for what we were going for.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights. I put them up on my pergola and have been a conversation piece ever since. Lovely at night. Stay on all night long and doesn’t cost me a penny in electricity. I have had nothing but compliments on them. We back up to entry road in our subdivision and I love seeing them as we drive by our house leaving and coming home. We have lots of coyotes around and helps me feel safe when I take my dogs out to potty at night. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great set of solar lights
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered 7 or 8 of these and draped them over our back fence. They are mainly for accent - not that bright - but provide an elegant glow and they last all night long! Had a problem with one strand but so far all the others are great. These are solar so easy to place anywhere. For less money you can get the led ones that plug in and they will of course be brighter. However this product is really good overall just don’t expect them to be anything more than a nice accent versus providing a lot of light.
customer_reviews.author: D. Prescott

customer_reviews.title: fantastic lighting
customer_reviews.text: I put these along the end of my patio and they look terrific. They give off sufficient, not too bright but bright enough light. I look forward to seeing them come on each night and I am more apt to sit out on the patio at night with enough light to be able to see along the edge of the yard. (I live in an area that has coyotes, bob cats, snakes and javalenas that can enter over a low brick wall and could eat my pup for dinner.) so the light is great
customer_reviews.author: jinmaine

customer_reviews.title: Great little lights anyone can install.
customer_reviews.text: These solar lights are pretty cool. I have the electrical ones prior like this. Still waiting for them to get brighter, maybe after the solar panel charges fully. Easy to install. Love them. UPDATE: They have been up for a week now and the panel in full sunlight in Southern California and these lights are so dim it is not even worth having them up!
customer_reviews.author: Kukunsoci

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful- great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: These lights are amazing. Great quality. Minor issue with one of the solar panels however customer service resolved issue promptly. Have had other type lights in the past however they filled up with rain water and no way to release it. These are screw in out type and thus far have not had to release water from the rain. Lights look great around patio awning. Just enough light! Perfect for my purpose. Hope you enjoy yours as well!
customer_reviews.author: Laura K. Schilling

customer_reviews.title: Don’t work, stay away
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if these reviews are fake or if I just got two boxes of defective lights. Bought them but didn’t put them up right away and now it’s too late to return, so I’m out $80 and now have to buy new lights. These don’t turn on until it’s pitch black out, we even tried covering the solar panels with a towel! They’ve been up for two weeks now and one string won’t even turn on. Do yourself a favor, don’t bother with these! They don’t work 😕
customer_reviews.author: lostmystic

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, brightness is mediocre
customer_reviews.text: I really love how classy these lights look! We put these on our back patio, and I specifically bought these to hopefully light up our back patio without the need of the bright outdoor lights. Unfortunately, the brightness wasn’t what I was hoping for. They get pretty dim just after an hour or so. However, the style is great and they were easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Becca Toor

customer_reviews.title: neat
customer_reviews.text: We love this on our outdoor yard , wished it had more lights on the string ... it is solar so very easy to use and the solor output is quite nice at night , you do not have to worry about turning on or off a switch and it just turns automatically on.... been using this outside for couple of months now and it works just great. wanting to get more , except a little bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Jenniffer “ Dabster “ Etchison

customer_reviews.title: Very bright, still going strong after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best solar lights I’ve ever used! I bought a string for my backyard 9 months ago and they’re still going strong! I’m amazed that on occasion I’ll wake up at 3am and the lights are still on. I just bought another string for my front yard and front walkway as it gets zero light and is pitch black at night. I was able to place the solar panel in an amazing sun location and now I feel very safe approaching my front door.
customer_reviews.author: boodger1

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lights for my daughter for camping. She put them up around the cover over the picnic table at the campground and pointed the solar eye towards the sun that morning. They came on as soon as it was dark and emitted a soft glow that was bright enough to light up the camping area. And... they stayed on all night! Every time she came out of the tent in the middle of the night they were on. What a relief to have light when it's so dark without having to light a lantern.
customer_reviews.author: V. L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great portable lights
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sets of these to use specifically for an event we were having on the beach. We strung them on portable posts and they provided great ambient lighting for the very intimate but casual gathering we were having. I liked that they weren't too bright and didn't blind you when you looked at them. The lights are plastic too so you don't have to worry about them breaking. They worked out perfect and I can see us taking these with us when we go camping too. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: ShaeCabby

customer_reviews.title: Lights were good, not great. Malfunctioned after a few days
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 other ones previously and they were ok. Doesnt give off much light so its more for outside mood lighting. My 4th strand has already malfunctioned after a couple days of use. Manufacturer wanted me to check bulb by bulb, unscrewing each one and changing it to another socket to see if its the bulb or fuse not working. Well, when you buy something, you expect it to work. Thats the deal. I give you money, you give me a working light. I shouldn't have to troubleshoot defective merchandise. And even if i had the time, the lights were already hung up on the porch. Too much hassle. Steer clear of these.
customer_reviews.author: J.Valles

customer_reviews.title: We live on the ocean and were looking for a ...
customer_reviews.text: We live on the ocean and were looking for a weatherproof product to stand up to the salt air. Two previous strings have failed, but these lights are very high quality and even the solar panel switch is sealed. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Weekes

customer_reviews.title: Didn't meet my brightness needs
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like these lights. The solar LED are only 1 watt. It was so dim, it was unnoticeable. I exchanged these for the ones you plug into a socket. THOSE are so much nicer AND I bought a remote control for the outlet too. Not a bad company. They seem to care about their product and their customers. This product just didn't cut it for me.
customer_reviews.author: TRFBTop Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: Lovely lights
customer_reviews.text: Really like the way these look. They seem much more durable than the skimpy thin strings you find elsewhere and the plastic bulbs are great. If these were glass I would have smashed all of them during installation. The solar panel clamps are very tight, and I needed two hands to work the clamps adequately. Positioning of the solar panels took two adjustments after we realized one panel wasn’t catching enough sun. Measure your space completely. We got two strings which ended up covering just the outside perimeters. I think these strings are 27 feet and that doesn’t go as far as you think it will. Order extra if you aren’t sure
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Still working strong after 2+ years
customer_reviews.text: Looking to buy strings of these lights. They work great. Bought 2 strings 2 years ago and they still look like they are new, and have weathered WI winters!! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, well made
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, well made. Charged within very few hours when I first installed them and ran for hours. I gave it four stars instead of five because I wished their light was a bit stronger
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Jay W. Randle

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy them again. Money wasted!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of these light sets on Oct 6th, delivered a couple of days later. Easy to install and worked as promised and stayed on for about 7 hours. Here’s the problem, it’s December 17th and I noticed about two weeks ago(December 1st) that the charge only last for about 2 hours now. I all ready need to replace them because only one comes on now. Definitely not worth spending the money on these solar lights. I wish I could return them but, I have missed the return date. I will not buy these again. Now have to search for more lights. 🙁
customer_reviews.author: DJ'S Creative Enterprise

customer_reviews.title: Great lights
customer_reviews.text: Bought two sets of these solar lights for my back porch and am very pleased how pretty they are and how much light they display. They turn on about 8:30 pm and turn off around 5:30 AM so I don't need to leave the porch light on. I would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joan H.

customer_reviews.title: These lights are the BOMB!
customer_reviews.text: We've had these hanging outside around my back yard side flower garden area for over a month now and they are still working great. They're brighter than shown in picture, it's hard to get a good shot in the dark. Anyway, they illuminate the entire area where they hang, I have two strings hanging in case anyone is wondering. I was actually pleasantly surprised by the quality, durability, functionality and brightness. These are an excellent buy and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Price

customer_reviews.title: NOT BRIGHT..NEED LONGER LENGTHS
customer_reviews.text: Lights do not make a lot of light. I imagine I will need multiple strings. When you are working with solar via string lighting, make the string light LONG in length with a heavier solar panel. Otherwise, you are going to have a ridiculous amount of small solar panels that will just look hideous. NOT A GOOD THING.
customer_reviews.author: EnviroLux

customer_reviews.title: Great amount of light after a full day's sunshine!
customer_reviews.text: Great lights for our night time sitting outdoors - wish it can be dimmed somehow, bright! They appear to be well made, don't know how waterproof they are, since ours hang under our awning. I like the looks of these - you can find it's cousin in stores but they require power, the fact they are solar powered is what got me to buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mathis

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!!! You Will Buy More
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my outdoor wedding in our back yard. I first just bought one strand so I could see how bright and make sure they worked good. The are so great I ended up buy a few more to go with it. I still need to go take them down however I have left them up for about a month now and they turn on at night and when I let the dogs out at 6 am, they are still on and bright as well. Great product and great mood lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Donny Cox

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE LIGHTS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first set and mounted them pretty easily. With a dusk to dawn feature, I waited for the night to come and I was blown away by how awesome they lit up the area. So much so I bought another set to put up in the same area for even more light. Their panels are a decent size and a better quality than I expected. They have been rained on, a day with not much sun and they still worked out great. Very happy with this product. I would by again.
customer_reviews.author: yohna

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these lights!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one strand and hung them on my deck fence. They turn on every night. I bought another set to put on my border fence. However, I just hung it temporarily on a hook on my deck. Oh my goodness! It is like I have a lantern shining on my backyard. I love these so much, I bought two more strands to put on my perimeter fence. They are so reliable and very sturdy so far. Despite Florida torrential rains, they still stay bright! LOVE THEM!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheree Rensel

customer_reviews.title: Great Solar lights
customer_reviews.text: Great lights! These lights have a nice warm color and make great accent lights. They are solar power and a great because you can put them anywhere and don’t have to worry about a plug. Solar lights due tend to be a little bit dimmer than plug in ones but they are still great for accent lighting. I have been able to get 6 hours of light out them as stated assuming the solar panel can get a good charge during the day. I will probably be buying some more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: These Lights Are What We Call A Yeah Boy Scenario
customer_reviews.text: These lights are perfect for my apartment balcony. They give off just enough light for comforting ambience, but are not so bright as to cause light pollution for my neighbors. They give off a nice warm glow instead of that new age LED blue light. The solar panel works great. You can clamp it just about anywhere. I don’t even have it in full sunlight and it still charges fine. Overall a great set of lights that will last you for years with their durable, weatherproof design.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Nice, bright, sturdy lights make for a nice addition to your yard at night.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the first set, I bought two more. It may have been easier to buy the longer set first. The bulbs are nice and strong. Great addition to a fence or backyard. I am contemplating buying two more sets, if I can figure out how best to install in the backyard. Also, these would be great on a balcony or other outdoor living space.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher C.

customer_reviews.title: Love'm
customer_reviews.text: At the price I figured why not. I did the Edison bulb thing and these are close. But the lights are great and a perfect brightness. Therer's lots of sun here now, so we'll see in the summer. Great product, do recommend. The "clamp", which is included , saved me from all kinds mounting bs. Worked great. Clamped on to down spout.
customer_reviews.author: Harpie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I know these lights are waterproof because we just had our first storm of the season...4 inches of heavy downpour. We’ve had 2 days of rain and overcast and these lights continue to burn all through the night. They last from dark (5:00pm) thru dawn. We live in a rural area with very little outside lighting and we are stringing this on our fence top. Just wish there were discounts for multiple quantities as we are going to need about 10 strands.
customer_reviews.author: i’ma72classic

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Man, we've really tried to find a bright set of lights for our camper, that would be completely solar. These are great. Not too expensive. They're not super bright though. Better than nothing, but you'll still need a lantern if you get far away from them. I like them because they're plastic and, as I said before, totally solar. They work on dimness of the surroundings, as well, so they come on at sundown, automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Armitage

customer_reviews.title: Made our Patio Glow!
customer_reviews.text: The power generated by the tiny solar panel, even in our cloudy mountain climate, is great. I love that the bulbs are thick plastic, so will not shatter if gently bumped. It says weatherproof and they have survived rainstorms; however, I try to only leave them out when I know the weather will be clear as the bulbs do fill with water and dew. Still, these fare far better than plug-in string lights would have. I used some old wood boughs to string them.
customer_reviews.author: Iliana

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why the review asked me about a remote control? These lights don’t have one. But they are beautiful! The perfect amount of light given off and they are so sturdy! We just had a tropical storm and these made it through without a mark on them. Love love love these! Will be buying more for the ready of the deck.
customer_reviews.author: Picard family

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor string lights!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are awesome!! They are really well built with sturdy cording and rubber tops with holes for mounting. They also have plastic bulbs which is really nice for outside. They turned on as soon as dusk hit which was awesome and they are a really good color! Love these and will definitely be getting more. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: My Review

customer_reviews.title: Great for our deck
customer_reviews.text: Great for our deck. The only complaint I have with these lights is that the “27ft” length is the length of the cord - the lighted portion is closer to 19 ft which means I had to buy a second on to light the three side of our 10x12 canopy section. Otherwise they charge during the day (as long as the switch on the solar panel is on) and then they light up the deck all night - Anytime I’ve woken up at 4:30 am the lights are still on. I hope they hold up to time, but they’ve served their purpose up to this point.
customer_reviews.author: Elogiodice

customer_reviews.title: I like them but...
customer_reviews.text: These are working great. The only think I don’t like is that they only come on when their sensor tells them it’s dark enough. I though I had a bit more control over them than that when I bought them. They are working great though... but at first I thought they were broken because we were trying to use them at dusk not dark. My boy friend took them apart and made sure every wire was attached. Not sure if he actually fixed them but as soon as he put the panel back on they turned on. I really like them but I’m not so sure about the quality or design.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, not the best product
customer_reviews.text: these have been up for a couple of weeks in our screened porch. The first night I loved them. After one week the plastic (around the little hole above the bulbs) broke for one of them making it difficult to hang. Ok, well, maybe that was just random. Then I noticed after the first week they were only on for like 3, maybe 4 hours. I was really excited about them being on longer. I live in Florida so there is plenty of sun to give these a good charge. Overall kind of disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Bright & beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I’m sorry to say I had to return these. I wanted a very soft white/dim type of light, but found these brighter than I expected. If you are looking for a set of solar lights that are a soft white on the brighter side, I’d highly recommend these. They seemed well made, sturdy and made of good quality. I wished they would have worked where I wanted to put them.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. Great ambient lighting
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I wanted to add some decorative lighting to patio cover for the evening and didn't want to get one which required a plug in. We've tried many in the past but it does no stay lit long enough in the evening. We were fortunate enough to find Brightech's lighting. Not only is it solar powered but it has a larger batter reserve than most. This enables it for a beautifully brighter lighting than most in the marker. We love this and looking to buy a few more. Note: is it not bright enough to replace any lighting you may need. It is a decorative piece.
customer_reviews.author: Allan C.

product_meta.title: Brightech Ambience Pro - Waterproof, Solar Powered Outdoor String Lights - 27 Ft Vintage Edison Bulbs Create Bistro Ambience On Your Patio - Commercial Grade, Shatterproof - 1W LED, Soft White Light
feature_bullets: "ITALIAN CAFE" LIGHTS USE VINTAGE EDISON BULBS TO CREATE GREAT AMBIENCE ON YOUR PATIO: Install Brightech's solar powered pergola lights as a canopy over your porch or gazebo for a retro bistro look and a pleasant party ambience. The Ambience Pros are bright enough to grill and eat, without being overpowering. Enjoy until late: They last 5-6 hours on a full charge, i.e. 6 hours of direct sunlight. Indirect sunlight works too, per reviews, but provides less charge/hour.

COMMERCIAL GRADE WEATHERPROOF BISTRO LIGHTS WITH SHATTERPROOF S14 BULBS: Customer reviews say Brightech’s Ambience Pros - with our own WeatherTite technology - withstood winds up to 50MPH, rain & snow. The bulbs are shatterproof plastic shells, with heat resistance up to 122 degrees Fahrenheit.

INSTALL FLEXIBILITY MAKES THIS THE BEST CARNIVAL LIGHT STRAND FOR WEDDINGS, BIRTHDAYS & PARTIES: Place the solar panel almost anywhere with the included stake and clip. Solar string lights don't need an outlet, so even spaces far from a building can be well lit. The ring over each bulb takes hooks or guide wire - connect all for a straight-line look or just some of the rings for a scalloped look.

LED, SOLAR OUTDOOR STRING LIGHTS Q&A & SPECS: Does this market lighting have an on/off switch? Yes, on the back of the panel. Are the bulbs replaceable? Yes. Do you need direct sunlight? No, indirect sunlight works too, but less well. Length: 27 feet. 12 bulbs, 20" between bulbs. The lighted portion is 20 feet; 6' between the solar panel and the first bulb. The LED bulbs last 20,000 hours. Light color: 2700K warm white.

BRIGHTECH'S 3 YEAR PRODUCT WARRANTY: We proudly stand behind all of our products 100%, which is why we offer a full 3 year warranty. If your lights have any defect or stop working within 3 years, we help you troubleshoot and/or send replacement parts or a whole new product. If any problems arise, please contact us because our number one goal is customer satisfaction.

specifications.Special Features: Rechargeable Battery, Portable, 6 hours to full charge
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,442 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
